title: React Basics Assignment
description: Complete exercises covering JSX, components, and props.

title: React State Project
description: Build a simple todo app using useState and props drilling.

title: React Routing Exercise
description: Implement multi-page navigation using React Router.

title: Node.js Setup Task
description: Set up a basic Node.js server and test with Postman.

title: Express Routing Assignment
description: Build RESTful routes using Express and middleware.

title: Async Programming Quiz
description: Quiz on callbacks, promises, and async/await.

title: MongoDB CRUD Project
description: Build a basic CRUD app with MongoDB and Mongoose.

title: Aggregation Pipeline Exercise
description: Use aggregation to summarize and transform MongoDB data.

title: MongoDB Atlas Deployment
description: Deploy your database to MongoDB Atlas and connect from app.

title: Python Basics Assignment
description: Practice variables, data types, and control structures.

title: Functions and Modules Task
description: Write Python functions and structure code with modules.

title: Library Usage Mini Project
description: Use standard libraries like `datetime` and `os` in a small project.

title: Docker Setup Lab
description: Install Docker and run containers using CLI.

title: Compose Services Exercise
description: Configure multi-container apps using Docker Compose.

title: Docker CI/CD Deployment
description: Deploy containerized app via GitHub Actions and Docker Hub.

title: AWS EC2 Setup Assignment
description: Launch and connect to EC2 instance for hosting apps.

title: AWS S3 Storage Task
description: Upload, manage, and access files using AWS S3.

title: Lambda Function Project
description: Create serverless functions with AWS Lambda.

title: TypeScript Types Exercise
description: Refactor JS code to TypeScript using type annotations.

title: Async/Await Task
description: Refactor callback-based code to use async/await.

title: TypeScript Build Project
description: Build and run a TypeScript project using tsconfig.
